Subject: Mark Reads After Dark
Description: Come and experience the best (worst) erotica that Chuck Tingle has to offer, read live and (totally unprepared for what's to come) by Mark Oshiro.  Speakers include:Mark Oshiro - Track: After Dark  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Crowd- & Alternatively Funding Your Career
Description: Our panelists discuss their experiences using entrepreneurship opportunities like Startup Weekend and Global Startup Battle or crowdfunding platforms like Kickstarter and Patreon, to supplement or make a living, or start a new project.  Speakers include:Tanya DePass, Mark Oshiro, Christina York, Noa Page - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Diversity in Geek Media
Description: The push for more diversity has become a regular topic in the world of genre media and games, from calling out instances of white-washing and queer-baiting, to protesting the inevitable and often inexplicable deaths of queer characters and characters of color. It's an exhausting road, but is it actually leading to more diverse and inclusive media?  Speakers include:Tanya DePass, Ann Lemay, Lingjia Tang, Mark Oshiro - Track: Media  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: When being 'on' is part and parcel of what people expect
Description: A panel where Mark Oshiro (Mark Does Stuff) and Tanya DePass (I Need Diverse Games) speak about the performative aspects of their work, including the need to entertain while doing blind reads and reactions to media and for Tanya; while streaming on Twitch/YT Gaming.  Speakers include:Tanya DePass, Mark Oshiro - Track: Media, Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Creating Safer Spaces
Description: How do we define a 'safe space' in fandom and at conventions? How can we work to create safer spaces for all attendees at Penguicon and other conventions, and in our lives outside of fandom? Join a discussion with Penguicon staff (including the con chair) and our guests about how the Penguicon commuity can work toward greater safety, diversity and inclusivity to make this a space where all feel welcome.  Speakers include:Mark Oshiro, Tanya DePass, Mari Brighe, Scott Kennedy, Sal Palland - Track: Penguicon  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
